text: Draught. Pours hazy pale yellow with a medium, sudsy white head. Aroma is floral hops, grapefruit, pine, and some dough. Taste is grapefruit, dough, mango, and a touch of pine. Juicy. Solid bitterness. Medium body. Soft carbonation. Smooth mouthfeel.

Poured from growler muled by ClarkVV hazy golden with a nice white head. Aromas of juicy citrus orange tropic fruit floral notes grain cracker. Taste is delicious lovely texture nice floral citrusy notes with mild pine. Wow.

Draft at Blackback. Feels like Im on jeopardy ordering this. Hazy golden pour with frothy white head, great retention and lacing. Aroma brings ... fruit juice (of the citrus variety - I want to say orange but I always want to say orange even though its probably some tropical fruit punch cocktail chock full of pineapple and stuff), grass - lean malt backing, hard to pick much out over the pungent hop punch. No caramel or anything, more in the biscuit / cracker direction, but its hiding so deep behind the hop component its hard to say much. Im stretching. Taste: light sweetness, moderate bitterness, lingering toasted Cheerios. Light+ body, average carbonation, soft texture. Overall: as best as a person can be objective, Id say this is an impressively well-crafted American pale ale. And here I am primed to love this -- getting out of the car once wed finally arrived into town a couple of hours ago I was positively giddy, stepping foot outside the gates of what may well be a neckbearded drunkards Mecca. Im looking forward to tomorrows pilgrimage to the holy site itself, but with some trepidation, because if Im being completely honest with myself, when faced with the question what is enlightenment? my hearts response is is that all there is? Perhaps its time to go dancing.
Draft at Alewife. Dry, fruity pale ale with notes if pear and melon. Cool tingle in the finish. Floral aroma. It has that Vermont freshness to it. Another really good one from HF.
Pours a hazy yellow with a white lacing. Aroma is citrus, with orange and grapefruit notes followed by grass
On tap at Black Back Pub, Waterbury. Aroma is a tropical citrus explosion. Taste is dry and tropical. An extremely tasty pale ale.

Where and how:  on tap at Prohibition Pig brewery 
Aroma: softer creamy wrap on citrus mid. Mellow even for HF. Gentle blend of hops behind, Smooth and pleasant. 7+
 Appearance : 
Top: creamy white long lasting top.
Base: cloudy, hazy pale gold. 
Palate :  soft bodied, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Mellow, smooth mid length finish. 
Taste: yeah, ultra smooth feel shown, price of such set up is the fact that flavor itself feels a bit muted. I do appreciate quality of brewing shown here, that is evident. Yet this brew is not perfect. Flavour wise , notes of mango, touch of lime, grape skins. Creamy finish.

Tap at propig. Pours clear yellow with lots of frothy head and tons of lacing. Nose is mango fruity. flaviurs of mango, some grapefruit, orange rind.taste med bitter light sweet. Full sticky body lively carbonation. Soooo good!

Flip top thanks to Steve. Pours out a golden wheat topped with a white head. Nose is orange citrus leafy hops and some cereal malts. Taste is more of the nice orange leafy hops a nice end cereal malts. Just a little bitterness on the end.
750ml growler. Cloudy golden with a frothy white head. Flavors are crisp cereals, sweet orange, bread and grass with spicy notes. Medium body, soft carbonation, smooth texture.

On draft at Hill Farmstead with ebone1988 on the Beercation. The pour is a foggy golden yellow eh a thin white head that leaves solid soapy lace as it falls. The aroma is dank as fuck. There is a good bitterness to it and then a hint of juiciness on the finish. The dankness is overpowering. The flavor is just as dank. There is an earthy hop bitterness to it, and a light juice on the back end. I like Conduct better than this one, but its good. The mouth feel is a little thinner with a nice carbonation and a lingering dank hop aftertaste. Its not too bad. HF is killing it.

750mL growler filled 5/27/16, drunk 6/8/16.Mildly to moderately hazy, bronze-tinged golden body is topped by a well-retained, large, white head.Very fruity, with a light wood-like hint that I often get from amarillo. Lots of lemons, tangerines, and grapefruit pith. Not resinous, no alcohol, no flaws and with the pleasing house character/minerality. Aroma strength is good, though it doesnt pour forth like Walden or even Sumner.And again, maybe a touch muted in the flavor, though everything is clean and highly flavorful. Perfect texture, with plentiful dry biscuit and cracker-like malt notes and a high dryness overall yet with a good, malty texture. Oranges, grapefruits, light stone fruits and just a hint of pine. Excellent and fantastically drinkable, and would be the star of most brewerys lineups. For Hill, its only just excellent....

Draft at Hill Farmstead with koleminer20. Aroma is grassy, juicy, tropical fruit, dank, fantastic. Appearance is golden amber, white head, haze. Taste is dank, grassy, juicy, resin, wow. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light carbonation, super dank aftertaste. Overall, this one is crazy dank and delicious.

On tap at the Blackback Pub.
This was poured into a tulip.
The appearance was a hazy burnt yellow/orange color with an ever so slight transparency about it. Some carbonation could be seen to fill a one finger white foamy head. Speckled lacing ran here and there around the glass.
The smell started started off with some full bittersweet citrus, sweet grass, "iced" pulp and rind, malts underneath.
The taste was basically the same with a subtle sweet citrus malt aftertaste and finish. The finish is semi-dry but nice.
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a pretty good sessionability about it. Carbonation rides good - fairly low, enough bitterness still nothing overbearing.
Overall, whale finally slain, damn good, and would definitely have again.

Growler from the brewery. A light, slightly hazy, silky-smooth pale ale that makes for pretty easy drinking. The aroma was all floral hops with a hint of citrus, and the flavor was a great mix of grain and hops. The bitterness was stronger than I was used to for Hill Farmstead, and I think it would have improved the beer if it was half as bitter. Still, 32ozs of this went down dangerously easily -- its delicious stuff.

On tap at brewery. Pours cloudy golden with white head. Aroma is tropical fruits, grapefruit, dank pine resin. Flavor is sticky sweet tropical fruits, pineapple, and mango. Finishes with grapefruit zest and dank pine resin.

En fût à la brasserie. On me sert une coupe que je ne me lasse pas dadmirer. Une belle coupe orangée, vivante, pétillante, vigoureuse et qui présente une épaisse couche de mousse blanche, semblable à la neige qui couvre les champs de la vallée du Richelieu. Cest vraiment superbe! Nez de riches cultivars et dun houblon balancé par cette levure saison que seul Shaun manie de la sorte! Crémeuse, douce, vive, balancée et parfaitement équilibrée, je suis charmé. Magnifique équilibre entre les malts qui pavent le chemin aux houblons mi résineux mi fruités. Cest soyeux et ample. Une parfaite représentante de son style!

Draft at Fools Gold, 12/5/15. Murky yellowish color with a decent amount of lace. Lemon/citrus, a bit of spice, done herbal notes as well. Fairly dry but with a decent balancing act from the spice and light sweetness. Quite tasty, though not quite as good as what they usually do with this style.

Tap, at the brewery. Murky yet bright, honeyed gold. Frothy, messy, sticky white head. Lots of citrus hop. Grapefruit pith. Grapefruit juice. Hint of lemongrass. Vanilla ice cream malts. Taste is citrus pith bitter. Some soft dryness. Smooth, fairly full body. Bitter finish, with a light dry close. Delicious.

750 mL growler . Originally reviewed 6/12/2013.

Very hazy golden orange. Small white head that lingers. Thin layer of foam rests atop the beer.

Bright citrus hop aroma. Grainy malt. Mostly hops.

Strong citrus hop flavor. Grapefruit and slightly tropical flavor. Grains behind it with almost no sweetness. The slightest hop bitterness. Oily hop flavor lingers on the palate 

Light bodied and quite drinkable. Medium carbonation.

Another great pale. Very tasty, clean, and drinkable as hell.
On tap in Stowe at Bench This is a world class APA for anyone who loves hops and smoothness.

Draft at Reservoir. Poured a bright yellow, fairly clear, foamy white head. Aroma of tropical fruits, grassy, herbal, slight floral hints. Flavor had some mango, lemon, grass, and herbal. Light body and slick texture to it. Bubbly carbonation and really smooth and slick finish. Another hoppy hit from HF.

750ml 3 days old growler from the brewery. Aroma: tropical fruits, grassy hops. App: hazy golden with thick white head and good retention considering this is 3 days old. And also leaving lacing. Taste and palate: fruity and herbacy in mouth, resinous, dry medium bitter finish. Overall: great. Pretty much the same as their other IPAs but more clean and less hoppy.

Draught at Prohibition Pig. It pours hazy golden - orange with a thick white head. The nose is soft, juicy, orange, tangerine, sticky marmalade, melon, faint cucumber, grass and dough. The taste is crisp, quite dry, high bitterness, grapefruit, orange, pithy citrus, grass, minerals, straw, pine and some pepper with a smooth, bitter finish. Medium body and fine, foamy carbonation. One of the more bitter and dry HF offerings. Crisp and refreshing.

Draft. A hazy yellow beer with a lazing white head. The aroma has notes of lemons, straw, hops, malt, and a bit of hay. The flavor is sweet with notes of lemons, hops, straw, and malt, leading to a bitter finish. High drinability.

This beer is the definition of focus. Pale yellow pour, large head, good retention, amazing aroma of citrus and Amazonian tree fruit. Taste is dry and lightly bitter. Flavors of deep tropical fruit, citrus. Amazing does not begin to describe it. Finished dry. Mind = blown.

On tap at Abbye in Worcester. Basically the same beer as Susan, but with fewer hops. Bartender gave me and a buddy both beers together and asked us to pick which one was which. Only difference was Susan was hoppier. Really good beer though.

Pretty much got my "Hill Farmstead" on at three penny tap. Pours golden Amber, slightly translucent. Slim white head that leaves a nice lacing coat. Lots of citrus, oranges, mango, slight bitterness. Light body.

The Farmhouse, Burlington, VT, draft. Yellow. Lacing lasts. Tastes a little thin, but bitter. Good, but expected more. In fairness, I'm distracted and the guy next to me keeps farting. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This poured a hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma was of resinous and lightly dank hips. Flavor similar, body incredibly soft and drinkable of.course.

On tap at brewery, in growlers, but most recently on tap @ The Jeffrey NYC. Pours a hazy opaque gold, small and creamy head. Aroma is melon, fresh grass, citrus, wheat, pineapple, grapefruit. Flavor has notes of creamsicle, melon sorbet, citrus, dry grass, faintly acidic lemon... Starts out gooey & wet resin, transitions and almost finishes dry. So much juicy but dry fruit, so little time... That is enlightenment.
Couleur dorée avec un col blanc mousseux. Aromes dagrumes, un peu de résine, céréales. Une très bonne Pale Ale, mais il y en a des competitive avec celle-ci!
Draft at the growler NYC. Pours a bright orange cloudy color. Has a hoppy smooth crisp finish. Very flavorful
Growler from the brewery. Pours a cloudy pale golden color with a white head. Aromas of tangerine, grapefruit, pine. Taste is light bitterness. Light body.
Draft. Glowing cloudy orange/gold with a frothy white head. Tons of citrus and tropical fruit with pine. Melon, grapefruit, tangerine and orange. Thin smooth mouthfeel and light carb. Great.

Growler. Cloudy yellow. Very sweet with big tart hops. Resinous. Slightly funky aroma. Wow, amazing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at HF. Poured light yellow with white head. Aroma dank resin juice. Light carb med bod. Tastes bitter resin drying.

Growler: Golden-yellow body, bright, vibrant, translucent. Topped with a soapy & foamy white head that settles nicely as a chunky collar. Aroma explodes with generous notes of pine, citrus zest, orange peel, grapefruit rind, bitter alpha oils, hop resin, & a touch of back-end dankness. Very little, if any, pale malt character. This is ALL hops on the nose. Lovely interplay between the Amarillo & Simcoe, too. Crisp little bitterness up front with each sip. Pines, leaves, grapefruit pith balances with juicier orange flesh. Hints of lemon zest, hop oil, a slight kick of bready yeast & a faint touch of pale biscuit malt left lingering with the citrus remains in the finish. Crisp, semi-dry body. Fantastic pale ale. Great balance between the bitter piney elements of Simcoe & the juicy, citric elements of Amarillo with just enough malt body to fulfill its purpose, yet remain light & refreshing. Stunning!

Sams bottle share...small snifters. Pours a semi-cloudy gold with a nice fluffy pillow head. Aroma is pine and light citrus with cereal and wheat. The taste is really well balanced with a wonderful hop profile of citrus and pine, but very smooth and nuanced. Finish is hoppy for a pale ale. Very very good.
Growler thanks to Will. Pours a cloudy gold with thick off white head. The aroma is strong simcoe, floral, pine. Medium mouthfeel with light pine, little bitterness. Good.
On tap at the brewery on 21. June 2014. Standing two hours in line. Big thank you to Russel for his patience and driving. Tastes not so far away from Edward but more yeasty in my opinion. Delicious.

Growler shared by yourefragile, thanks Moll. Pours a beautiful bright hazy straw yellow with fading white head that left thick lacing. Aroma is bright dank hop bitterness. Flavor is bright citrus bitterness with active carbonation. Medium bodied, delicious.
Hazy yellow with a big white head. Grapefruit and lemon aromas lead into a light and friendly hop flavor. One of my favorite hop combinations. Finish lingers with the tart citrus flavors. Well done.
From notes. Taster at the source. Pours Hfs yellow, with a white head. Aroma is dank, grapefruit, floral. Tastes soft, floral, grapefruit peel. Pine, grass bitter in the finish.
on tap at the Farmhouse in Burlington. pours hazy golden yellow with a nce white head. passion fruits and pineapple in the aroma, malts and pinecone finish on the tongue. great pale ale.

On tap at the brewery. Milky pale yellow pour with a white head. Sweet citrus and fruity hop aromas. Citrusy hop notes dominate with undercurrents of pine. Good balance with a somewhat understated malt presence. Good body and mouthfeel.

On tap and Farmhouse Tap and Grill. Pours cloudy gold with a frothy white top. Aroma is intense pine and floral hops. Taste is such a well balanced beer, great hop flavouring and bitterness, cereal and earthy malts. Pleasure.
This was a fantastic one. Hazy straw golden color. Huge floral aroma with simcoe pine dominating. Delicious.

On tap at the Farmhouse in Burlington, a light pale yellow pour... tastes of hops leaning toward the straw, weedy end... with light citrus flavors and mild bitterness.... no discernible malt- thank you- ... reminds me of a Belgian white... more austere compared to other HF offerings (tasted alongside Edward, and Sip of Sunshine-- yeah, that was a rough lunch!).

Growler. Pours bright murky yellow with thin white head that lingers. Grapefruit aroma with little carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Fantastic floral pale. Cloudy orange yellow. Ton of citrus, pineapple, melon in the nose and taste. Very light and balanced. Sweet enough, but nowhere near cloying. Could drink this all day.
Great session. Very Light and well balanced session, slightly tart and citrus, drink for days.

This beer is obsessive. Had it first at the Mad Taco in Waitsfield purely by chance, as I was vaguely familiar with Hill Farmstead, and the sweet counter person suggested it a good match with my order. This beer literally blew me away, as I normally gravitate to Belgiums and stouts. The hops are a subtle citrus and pine, while the taste is lightly bitter with a lasting finish. In the glass its golden and hazy, To me its one of the best beers Ive ever had.

Poured into tulip from a growler: Pours hazy orange / yellow with a thin white head. Aroma is cereal malts, citrus, grapefruit, light floral. Taste is very light, but with a lot of flavor. Mostly grassy malt, light grapefruit and other fruits. Light body, slightly bitter finish. Very tasty.

Cloudy pale yellow, very lacy white head. Incredibly fruity nose, melon pineapple. Very bitter, astringent. Medium body, oily, very long finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Mousse blanche abondante sur un liquide mi-épais, parfaitement opaque et de couleur paille, ou jus de poires. Nez tout en houblons, avec peut-être une petite pointe dacidité. En saveurs, elle penche du côté fruité et poivré, presque comme une saison copieusement houblonnée, avec des pêches et des ananas qui dominent. Un peu mince finalement, elle est cependant assez savoureuse pour soutenir lintérêt du buveur. Une bonne APA, un peu hors des sentiers battus, mais foutrement solide.

2pz taster at the brewery. Pours a hazy yellow amber color with a big white head. Aroma is hoppy, citrus, pineapple, some pine. Medium on the palate with creamy carbonation. Flavor is sweet, just a little cereal, pine hops, some citrus, with a light, bitter finish.

[5263-20130426] Tap. Mild yeast scented water aroma. Hazy, light orange body with a medium-lasting creamy white head. Bitter lemon yeast and toasted grains flavour. Medium body. Very tasty. (7/4/9/4/16) 4.0
(@ Black Back Pub, Waterbury, VT)

Hazy golden amber, tight white head. Nose has fairly balanced grain notes, fresh, a lot like Edward. Hops have are herbal and grassy. light grapefruit, a touch light in the nose. Definitely the lightest on flavor, clean fresh grain, light cereal and dough, dry finish with more bitterness than some of the others. Grapefruit and orange citrus are light, hint of peach and grassy hops on a light body with strong carbonation.

(retrouvé dans mon backlog!) Bue au 2e anniversaire: Une blonde agressivement aromatique, florale, tropicale, douce résine dans un corps craquant et faiblement sucré. Une des meilleures pale ale brassée sur cette planète.

Made the long motorcycle journey to Greensboro, VT, braved the dirt roads to get to Hill Farmstead Brewery and enjoy on tap in June 2012.

A: Citrus, hops and pineapple. Strong, amazing pineapple in the nose. The malts break through toward the end. 
A: Hazy burnt-golden color, with a small head that fades rather quickly. 
T: Mild hop presence and creamy malts up front. The citrus and tropical fruits really shine on the back end. Goes down smoothly and on a warmer day I could put down several of these very quickly. 
P: Perfect carbonation. Fairly strong bodied for the style. Crisp and smooth. 
O: An excellent representation of the style. One of the best APAs Ive ever had. Beg, borrow or steal to get this!
Aroma is wood grainy, appearance is golden taste citrus bitter palate is grapefruit, over good pa

75cl growler at home, shared with Mathieu87.
APPEARANCE: lightly clouded blond beer, small unstable white head.
NOSE: fresh, very fruity, really pleasant citrus, some mango, grapes even.
TASTE: fresh, bitter aftertaste, little dry out even, fruity, nice hop balance.

From growler, courtesy of Peter & Yolanda. Beautiful hop aroma - piney, apricot, pineapple - sweet and luscious. Pale golden haze with thin white lacing head. Medium body with medium-high carbonation. Starts medium sweet with tons of hop flavors. Mild bitterness but intense flavor. A delicious APA and a real treat to try.

750mL growler purchased at the brewery. Shared with friends on 7/9/13. Clear gold pour with a medium white head. Aroma of mango, citrus, malt and pine. Malty flavor with grapefruit and pine accents before a bitter grapefruit peel finish. Very well done.

Courtesy of tectactoe
Growler: The aroma consists of moderate citrus, grapefruit, and light dank hops. It pours slightly hazy dull golden-orange with a small white head that fades to a thin film outlined by a slightly thicker ring. The flavor starts with quick dose of citrus. The finish has moderate grapefruit, pine, and a touch of lemon. Its light-medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Another killer Pale Ale from Hill Farmstead.

Growler @ home. Pours a hazy light yellow orange appearance with a white wheat. Somewhat spicy, light onion, herbal, pineapple, grapefruity aroma. A bit chewy, bready, spicy, lightly dank, grapefruity, garlic/onion, cracker flavor that finishes a bit spicy. Refreshing and just too fucken easy to drink. Really a nice and flavorful APA. Thanks JesusOfVT!

On tap. Pours a cloudy amber. Subtle aroma of grass. Really fresh tasting, with great hop balance. Very refreshing.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Had as a taster at brewery. Slightly hazy pale golden light head, med lacing. Bit of a citrus bite, Carmel undertones. Smooth. More lemony than Edward. Slightly more carbonated than Edward as well. Medium long finish.

Ever so slightly hazy golden orange, thin white head. Somewhat fainter aroma of grapefruit, citrus, and hints of peach. Light sweetness followed by the perfect amount of bitterness in the back. Light-bodied, no alcohol presence. Clean, crisp, and very refreshing.
Growler 750mL. Jaune paille légèrement trouble. Beau nez fruité: houblons tropicaux. Bouche un peu mince, agrumes et un peu de miel de trèfle. Finale sèche.

Draft at HF. Pours a pale gold with some haze and white head. Nose is citrusy with some notes of mango and earth, faint onion. On tasting, intensely bitter and dry. Crisp and fresh with more citrus and cat pee notes, low onion that works. Moderate malt comes through. Finish is quite dry. Really great apa.

A - pours hazy light straw. Low white head that settle into a ring. S - very fruity ipa.  pineapple, lemon, lime first. Piney and dried grasses.  M - light and bright. dry and bitter. T - pine and bright citrus up front. Pineapple and grapefruit first. Tea bitters, vegetal malts and dried grasses. O - light bright fruity hop heavy ipa.  3.9
Tasted at HF, pours cloudy gold with thick foamy head.  Big hop and citrus smell, very dry, very good

UPDATED: JUN 18, 2013 750mL growler, sent from Glouglouburp (thanks Dany), pours a cloudy golden yellow with one-finger length of foamy white head. Aroma brings out loads of floral hops and citrus zest, backed by some biscuity crackery malt - its got that classic Hill Farmstead meadow-like nose. Flavour is similar, bringing out super fresh floral hops, citrus zest, a little pine, a touch of pineapple, and some nice soft crackery malt to back. Extremely dry, crisp and refreshing, with a wonderful balance of flavours. One of the best thirst beers Ive ever had - could drink litres of this stuff. Exceptional pale ale.

750ml growler thanks to onebigtymer11. Drinking for Father's Day. Pours a hazy dark straw color. Aroma of pineapple, grapefruit, apricot, peaches, and orange peel. Taste is similar. Lots of citrus and tropical fruits, and biscuit malts. Medium bitterness. This is a great APA.
Growler pour. Light golden pour with white lacing. Citrus and grassy herbal hop aromas. Flavor is super fresh herbal and citrus hop tones.

growler. pours hazy almost cloudy pale yellow-grey-ish with a minimal white head, some retention and lacing, which is quite nice for a 18 days old growler. very fresh and bright citrus, green goodness, some dankness, soft pine needles, pale malts and wheat, hint of acidity. average carbonation, light body - never watery, relatively short and very nice citrusy-lightly piney finish, much more aromatic than bitter. good balance. dangerously quenching and good!

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2013 Growler shared by czar, muy thanks! Pours a really pale yellow and cloudy. Aroma is fresh, piney, dank and feeling juicy too. Quite a nice blend of hops I must say! Taste is bone dry with a medium level of bitterness lingering for a while. Flavors are once again only hoppy, mostly piney with no discernable malt. Ultra drinkable. A good one!
Hazy gold pour, big white head. Medium strength hoppy aroma. Well balanced citrusy hoppy flavor with grapefruit notes. Medium large body.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2014 Sampled at the brewery.  Pours cloudy golden with a lacy, white head.  Aroma of citrusy and floral hops plus some caramel and pale malts.  Flavor a perfect blend.  Average texture.  Great.
Edit (6/11/14): 750ml growler in a Hill Farmstead glass.  Pours the same color as most HF hoppy beers.  Aroma strong of the citrusy and floral and fruity hops, some pale malts with a nice crispness.  Flavor the same with an amazing blend.  Still amazing.  Imagine that, HF keeps making great beers.

750 ml flip top from 46er3498.  Pours a clear light orange color with a medium fizzy head that lingers nicely, leaves a little oily webbing.  Aromas are perfumy flowers, lemon zest, musty grass, and grapefruit.  Taste is all hops fresh perfumy hops.  Flowers and lemons mostly.  No malt detectable.  Different spices and herbs show up in the finish as well.  Light body and a slightly oily mouthfeel.  Overall, this is good but Im surprised at so many rave reviews.  I would expect to taste some malt in an APA.

Pours a cloudy light orange with white head and so e lacing. Aroma of mangos, peaches, grapefruits, lots fruity caracters. Taste is full of the same fruits with a nice little malt backbone. Little bitterness. Low body and medium carb. A winner here!

Tap. Pours hazy yellow amber with a medium white heady that dissipates slowly with nice lacing. Aroma is citrus, grass, lemon zest. Flavor is the same, light sweet and light bitter. Light body, soft, creamy mouthfeel.
Growler shared by Kan, thanks! Pours hazed bright yellow gold with white head. Aroma has vanilla, grass, hay, pine. Flavors are grassy, citrus, pine needles. Great balance to this apa.
Dry pale ale, nice fruitiness, slgiht spice, medium to low bitterness, balanced and tasty.

23rd September 2012Very hazy gold beer, little white head. Palate is light and crispy but turning softer. Semi dry. Very mild malt cream under marvellous fresh pink grapefruit hops. Touch of yellow grapefruit hops and lesser orange citrus. Mildly bitter seltzer minerals. Finishes fairly neutral with a nice citric bitter aftertaste. Beautifully put together and very refreshing.

2L growler thanks to Nick poured in HF stemware. Pours a typical Hill opaque yellow orange with a massive white head that dissipates to a slight bubbly film. Smell is citrus, orange, hay, and a little bread. Taste follow with a slight piney bitterness. Really excellent session brew.

Pours a hazy yellow golden color with a two finger foam. On the nose its got some nice juicy orange, earthy straw and a trace of pine. The palate follows the nose but is more rustic and grassy. Heavy carbonation scrubs the citrus notes away quickly and the bitter earthy flavors hold strong as the finish comes across clean and focused.

Pours unclear golden with an orange hue, thicker for the style which is nice. Aroma is the only thing that is not balanced here because it is so light. What you do get in the nose is so juicy and delicious, some citrus sweet hops. The body and flavor are perfectly balanced, as usual for HF. It brings juicy hops with just the right tang, and citrus, soft without any hop bite at all. Each sip gets better, refreshing the palate on a warm spring day just like ana APA should do. Lingers on the tongue just long enough until you are going back for more.

Growler, thanks to quackus42, 05/06/2013. Pours cloudy tangerine, dense creamy white head settles comfortably on the surface, thick soapy lacing all around. Aroma is soft grapefruit, cantaloupe, melon, pineapple, other tropical notes, grassy notes in the middle with mild toasted malts on the end. Taste is brighter, sharp citrus with grapefruits, soft caramel sweetness lurking in the background, long bitter finish. Refreshing body, pops in the mouth, super drinkable. Really nice, stands up to best coming from the West Coast and then some.

Dégustée en fût chez "The Reservoir Restaurant & Taproom" à Waterbury, VT. De couleur dorée-jaune et légèrement voilée.  Nez de houblon fruité (agrumes et zeste, léger de fruits tropicaux), moyennement citrique, légèrement floral et herbeux, léger de pain et de céréales. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen ainsi quune texture légèrement huileuse. Goût moyennement amer de houblon fruité (agrumes et zeste, moyen de fruits tropicaux), citrique, légèrement floral et herbeux (une amertume présente toute la gorgée) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un moyen goût de pain avec un léger goût de céréales puis en finale lamertume de houblon se veut asséchante et plus herbeuse.  Post-goût long-moyen et moyennement sec, moyennement amer de houblon fruité, herbeux et moyennement. (1er mai 2013)

2013-04-26. Lightly hazy bright orange body, nice fluffy white head. Aroma is modest, mild hops, bit muted while cold. Flavour is pleasant, modest bitterness and citrus throughout, mild orange, light pith and orange peel. Smooth average Palate, modest carb. Quite quaffable, just a touch mild overall. On tap at Blackback Pub, Waterbury

On tap at Blue Bird in Burlington.

Pours a hazy, glowing yellowish orange with a frothy off white head.  Fairly sweet, juicy aroma of grapefruit and orange, some grass and lemon, and faint doughy malt.  Like nose, flavor starts initially sweet, orange and other tropical notes before giving way to a grassy bitter finish.  I prefer Edward to this, but that might just be more out of conditioning than anything else.

En fût. Pinte dégustée chez Parker Pie Co. (West Glover, VT). Arôme: Odeur de zestes de citron et de pamplemousse. Apparence: La couleur est blonde voilée avec une moyenne densité de bulle. Présence dun moyen col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de citron et de pamplemousse avec une pointe dananas. Longue durée de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement huileuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Présence dagrumes en arrière goût. (Rating #4421)

750 mL growler. Thanks to Michael for the acquisition. Shared with Adam and Mike.

The beer is mildly hazy and appears a golden yellow color. The white head is about a half inch thick and leaves ample lacing on the tulip.

The nose is excellent. Dank hops and a variety of tropical fruits and citrus. Oh yeah...

The flavor is earthy with notes of well water (in a most positive way). Lots of citrus and hop notes. Simply fantastic. Chuggable. Another winner from Hill Farmstead. I think this is the best pale ale I have ever had. I am dumbfounded. I could drink this indefinitely.

What is Enlightenment? Well, the Dalai Lama, Thich Nhat Hanh, and apparently, Shaun Hill.

Serving type: growler

Reviewed on: 05-30-2012

Growler at the cabin, NH. Pours a lightly hazy, light gold with a small, creamy white head. Beautiful nose with all kinds of heady citrus, tons of grapefruit and orange. Flavor follows perfectly with tons of juicy, wet citrus, touches of dry peel, faint fresh grass. Medium bodied with average, super smooth and creamy carbonation. Lightly resinous to finish with nips of pine and grass, moderate sweet pale malts, continuous fresh grapefruit, orange and pineapple, hints of yeast and woody dryness. Lasting pithy citrus. Sublime.

32 oz. growler served in a Portsmouth tulip. Huge thanks to Sean (Sean9689) for sharing another HF brew!

A: Pours a hazy gold color with light peach hues. A thick and foamy white head forms on the pours and recedes to a nice ring and film that leave some splotchy lace behind.

S: The nose just explodes with intense hops. Robust pineapple, sweet golden delicious apples and mango are the wonderful fruits up front. There is some nice grassy hops in the middle and the finish is of sweet bread malts.

T: The malts show themselves a bit more in the taste, but it is still wonderfully balanced. Great citrus and tropical fruit flesh with tastes of pineapple and mango with a mix of grassy hops and sweet bread malts.

M: Light bodied with perfect carbonation. Nice and refreshing with a sweet malt and fruit combination that lingers long after the finish.

O: As with the rest of the group I was blown away to find it was only Amarillo and Simcoe hops in this brew. Superbly crafted and wonderfully balanced. The nose was unreal and I could really drink this stuff all day. Please, please, please make this part of the regular rotation. I havent been this blown away by an APA since my first encounter with Zombie Dust.

Serving type: growler

Reviewed on: 05-15-2012

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2013 In short: A superb refreshing and highly aromatic hoppy blond IPA bursting with floral and tropical fruits hops
How: A few times on tap.  This rating for a growler consumed fresh the day of purchase
The look: Cloudy yellow-blond body topped by a medium white head leaving lots of lacings on the glass
In long: As usual from HF hoppy beer, heres a highly aromatic hoppy nose, fresh an vibrant.  This one proposes a strong floral character backed by tropical fruits.  Body is typical blond IPA malt bill, a mix of fresh baguette, crisp crackers, low sweetess, soft bubbles.  Hopping provides a clean and flavorful bitterness that is more refreshing than intense.  I had this beer on tap on many occasions at the brewery and it is surprising how a few weeks can change a beer.  Once I noted that it was the least bitter of all the very hoppy beer Ive had, a few weeks later I found the bitterness was rather sharp.  But it was always excellent, and maybe my favorite of the all the Hill Farmstead single IPAs.  And if you are drinking this beer and a major in philosophy asks you what you are drinking, lie, make up a beer name, dont answer, just dont say the beer name, trust me on this one.

On tap at Prohibition Pig, Waterbury VT.  Delicate aroma of flowers, white fruits and banana; theres a creaminess and tartness to it that suggests wheat.  Its dry, and deep, but still somewhat simple.  Flavor is a brisk blend of grasses, flowers, and citrus skins; again, dry, and deeper than it seems.  Light body; finish is pithy and zesty, and surprisingly long; easy, and quenching, very well composed.
growler from ernie. pours hazy yellow with pillow white head. big hoppy grass aroma. semi dry medium mouth

Pours a hazy light golden color with a small white head. Aroma is of a grassy citrus and tropical hops with some pine mixed in. Taste follows the nose with a thiner body and a mild malt build. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
i believe drunk preachers .. . pours a medium caramel .. great foam .. . mild mouth, good amount citrus and pine .. . such an awesome session pale .. . . hello kitty, say hello to kitty litter.

A hazed golden ale with a thick lacing white head. In aroma, superb mix of pungent grassy and citrusy hops, meaty, menthol notes, wonderful. In mouth, nice and smooth lactic malt with loads ofl resinous hops, yet silly and smooth. On tap at Somerville Summerfest, July 14, 2012.

If there can be such a thing, then it is a perfect beer. Not too bitter, not too sweet. Complex and wonderful. Makes me want to move to the area.

The brewery is way, way, way off the beaten track, but well worth the effort to get there.
Aroma: bread, cereal, herbs, citrus, floral
APPEARANCE: pale, hazy, frothy
TASTE: medium sweetness, medium bitterness
PALATE: medium body, average carbonation, long finish

Acquired in a trade from Adam. Big thanks for this one man! Shared this growler at home with my dad. Poured a hazy orange color, with a nice white head. Aroma is citrus, somewhat floral, grapefruit, orange peel, some bread, and wheat. Taste is sweet tropical fruits, citrus, grass, grapefruit, biscuit, and lemon peel. Mouthfeel is medim with high carbonation. So glad to taste another pale ale from HF and another winner. Cheers!

On draft at Cigar City, poured a cloudy golden color, aromas of lit caramel, citrus, and some grassy hops.   Flavors are the same, blended nicly, light bitterness at the end, solid beer would easily drink again.

Pours a hazy golden/honey color with a medium creamy white head...nice retention and lacing.  Aroma has grass, citrus, light spice, tea, and mild straw.  Flavor has very mild malty/caramel notes and nice grassy/citrusy and spicy hop notes...pleasant bitterness.  Mouthfeel is medium and silky with an earthy/bitter dry finish.

From growler.
Pours hazy blond with low white head. Very nice lacing. Aroma is of citrus, hops, fruits (tropical), pine/resinous. Taste is of citrus, hop, fruits, pine/resinous. Overall: Thin. Very good. Nice resinous features, especially in aroma.

Growler... Cloudy peach-colored ale with a small, creamy, white head. Good retention. The aromatic highlights are citrusy, musky, peppery hops. Full-bodied with a creamy mouthfeel and tingly carbonation. Nicely balanced. Fruity, rindy bitterness keeps ultra-pale malt sweetness in check. Moderately bitter, fuzzy fruit finish. Growler courtesy of landhoney!

Pours cloudy straw with small white head and some lacing. Very nice aroma of tropical fruits, herbs, orange and pine. Taste, however, does not live up to the promises of the aroma. Where did the fruits go? Strong resinous taste. Really good beer nevertheless.

UPDATED: APR 29, 2013 Rerated after drinking it on tap @ Blackback. Growler (750 ml) brought back earlier in the day from Hill Farmstead. Hazy glowing yellow with a huge white head and heavy lacing. So much citrus in there with orange, lemon and grapefruits with slight spices and pine. Taste is less explosive than aroma but still very good: orange peel, lemony presence, grapefruit, pine. Mouthfeel is moderately dry. Good balance. A very nice refreshing beer!

64 oz growler. Pale gold pour, white head. Super citrusy aroma, thick lemon and orange peel, a bit of white pepper. Taste of fruity hops, nice lemony finish. Super dry and just perfect. Bitterness is balanced, palate is light and refreshing everything is just wonderful. Now have to get Shaun to bury a tapline all the way to my house.

Thanks to sean for this.  Hazy yellow/gold pour, white head.  Aroma is loaded with nice citrus, some wheat, light bready notes.  Flavor is delicious.  So full of citrus flavor, grains, light hops, yeast.  Wonderful!

Growler thanks to your trade. Pours a hazy pale gold with a slight orange hue and a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a nice citrus note with a hint of grass and a light grain backing. Flavor has a nice hop profile of pine, citrus and grass with a nice light grain backing.
Hazy yellow with modest head and lacing. Light wheat and hops. Very pleasant to drink... Refreshing.

From growler by Daknole at Drowlands tasting:  hazy straw yellow pour, white head, aroma of great floral hops some citrus light grain, very good dry hoppy finish, good mouth feel, grassy floral hop taste. very drinkable, and i wish i could get this more easily.

750 ml direct from the brewery. Pours a hazy pale golden with a small lacing white head. Aroma is malty with lots and lots of juicy grapefruit.  Lightly spicy. Balanced hops, light malts and seems perfect for drinking large amounts. Aroma of freshly cut wet grass, very subtle pine. Lots of juicy fruit. Mild hop bitterness. Medium in body. I think I find this more refreshing then Edward and I didnt think that would be possible. World class APA.

Tallahassee, Fl - at drowlands 7/7/12 going away tasting party - thanks to daknole. Light gold pour, light white head. Some spruce in the aroma, hint of pears. Flavor is full of juicy fruit gum goodness. Hints of grapefruit, some pears, hint of spiciness on the back end. Sticky mouthfeel.

UPDATED: NOV 14, 2012 7/7/12. Shared at my going away tasting by daknole! Hazy orange pour with a nice head. Slightly funky and nicely fruity aroma with plenty of hop. Nice fruity and crisp hoppy flavor with plenty of malt backing. Nice!
UPDATED: JUL 8, 2012 Bottle from daknole! Pale slightly hazy gold with white head. Nice citrus hop nose with pine. Nice floral and spicy hops with a bitter finish. Pretty tasty.

750ml growler pours a hazy, dark yellow with some cloudy white head.  Nose is nice, zesty hops, grapefruit zest, lemons, floral, light honey.  Flavor is sweet, lightly bitter, grapefruit zest, bitter greens.  Finishes bone dry and zest.

Wow. HF does it again. Tap at CCB. Nose is huge citrus and sweet malts with tons of apricot, mango, and grassy/floral notes. Crazy! Pour is hazy orange color with a frothy white head. Taste is very balanced with some caramel malt and tons of grassy, citrusy hops. Very drinkable! An amazing apa from Hill Farmstead.

Hazy yellow pour thin white head very light lacing ... aroma is of citrusy lemon peel hops sugary, lightly grainy/biscuity malts and floral hops .... taste is a lot like daisy cutter just dumbed down a bit, citrusy bitter lemon peel, little sugary, grainy/biscuity malts and a bit of floral hops ... very sessionable and dangerous apa

Growler from the brewery...Hazy yellow pour,two finger white head,good lacing.Aroma is malt sweetness,citrus,grass,pine etc... Good grassy hop flavor,touch of resin and some citrus.Low carbonation and lighter body makes it very easy to drink.Nice simple pale to drink while you mow the lawn.
damn good beer.  floral, citrussy, long lingering bitterness.  medium dryness, medium-light body.  these guys know how to handle hops.

On tap at Prohibition for Mystery Keg night. Pours cloudy, hazy sunshine golden yellow with a thin, finger-width head that settles down to leave a seafoam sheen over the surface. Lacing is full and comes in fuzzy sheets. Aroma of freshly mown grass, lemon zest, bitter orange peel, soft grapefruit and tangerine notes, and a tremendous dose of pineapple on the tail. Palate is creamy, smooth, perfectly carbonated, and perfect. Tastes slightly tart, with tangy orange and pineapple and just tons of resiny, juicy hop nectar. This is fucking amazing in every regard. Easily the one of the best pale ales in the world, hands down. It reminds me of Heady Topper, but smoother, creamier, and with less booze. I would drink this and RR Row 2 / Hill 56 the rest of my life if I could. Outstanding.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Another winner, straw slightly, very floral and citrusy, pot pourri notes. Beautifully executed. Another amazing IPA from hill farmstead

Hazy pale gold with no head. Aroma is dominated by simcoe hops, very citrusy. Taste follows, bitter and refreshing. Borders on ipa for sure. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Growler shared by yourefragile. Thanks! Pours a hazy orange color with a medium sized frothy off-white head. Decent head retention. Aroma of tropical and citrus notes, some herbal notes and pale malts. The taste is pale malts, citrus, tropical notes, some tart and earthy notes and a slight lingering bitterness. Medium-full bodied, well balanced. Really an exceptional beer.

UPDATED: JUL 18, 2013 Served on-tap at Tired Hands as well as Teresas Next Door during Philly Beer Week.


A - Pours hazy peach orange a decent one finger tall white head leaving spotty trails of lace down most of the glass. Very nice color, went a tiny bit dull at the end of the glass.


S - Smells of pungent citric hops, tropical fruits - mostly oranges, grapefruit and mango -  some caramel sweetness, pine needles and a bit of lightly toasted pale malt. This one has a really intoxicating nose.


T - Starts off with a huge citric hop bite quickly giving way to hints of fresh tropical fruit, fresh pine, caramel and a bit of pale malt. Finish is very hoppy, leaving the palate very dry long after consumption.


M - Medium body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Real nice light feel with a ton of hop resins throughout. This one just really works.


O - Definitely another winner right here. I could drink this all day and night, it is so damn easy to drink. Hope I get to have this again someday.

UPDATED: SEP 13, 2012 Draft at UES Pony bar. Pours a deep, but bright orange body with thin white lacing. Aroma is soft tropical fruits, fresh pine, sweet bubblegum and light funky dank. Mouthfeel is soft, fluffy and creamy with notes of bitter grapefruit, fresh pine, orange, dank weed, melon, light passion fruit, and cotton candy. Oh daddy, the only tap they dont fill growlers of, and lucky for you because you bet your ass I was leaving with 3 of them. Well played hill farmstead, further solidifying your position as a world class brewery with this extremely drinkable pale ale. Dad.

Uberfresh pine and spruce from the Simcoe, orange and lemon from the Amarillo, along with those gorgeous fresh hop characteristics of onion and leek. So refreshing, hoppy, and delightfully easy drinking. I think if I had ready access to a profile of Shauns beers I could convince anyone on earth that this is the best brewery in the world.

Hazy orange amber color with a medium sized, white head that left nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma of floral hops, amarillo, pine, resin, orange, and citrus.  Taste of orange, light pine, citrus, grapefruit, light toffee sweetness, and a resiny finish.
Swing top to pint. Looks good; orange and heady. Smells great! Citra hops all the way. Tastes good; nice and balanced with a pleasant feel. Very good stuff!

On tap at Tria Fermentation.  Poured a cloudy lemonade with light brown hues and a small white head.  Wonderful citrus aroma flows from the glass with guava and grassy notes introducing themselves gently.  First sip is refreshing elegance with hints of pear, guava, grapefruit, floral and grass.  Amazing pale ale fit for all palates.

Draft at Tria fermentation school... Good looking brewski. Copper/orange in color. Smells like your typical pale ale. Hops up front... Taste isnt bitter, but still hoppy and well balanced. Flowery, grassy, fruity...Light body, easy to drink.  Well balanced. A very sessionable pale ale.

On tap at boilermaker, had a good pours an  ultra hazy golden yellow, thin white lace, impressive lacing. Aromas of grapefruit rinds, pine, tangerine zest, lemon sorbet, orange juice, tropical and fruity simcoe and amarillo hops. Taste is maybe better then the aroma if its possible, reminds me of double sunshine, pineapples, guava, orange marmalade, resionous pine, vanilla, light sprinkle cheese and grapefruit, nice malt profile comes out only at the end where it belongs to wrap this dank goodness up in a warm juicy blanket. Not bitter at all. Doesnt get any better then this.

750mL Growler, thanks to Glouglouburp. Holy shit Dany!!! Pours cloudy pale strawgold, thin white head, and fine lacing. Nose is fantastic, almost ethereal with grapefruit, spice, creamed mangoes, just a stunning nose, WAY above what I would expect from an APA. Flavours of grapefruit, fresh cream, spice, light soap, florals/perfume towards the finish. Just a stunning brew!

@ Boilermaker.  Golden straw body.  Large off-white head.  Spotting lacing.  Nose is jammed with grapefruit, lemon, floral notes, and grass.  Assertive for a pale ale at this ABV.  Taste is quite similar to the nose.  Medium bodied.  Appropriate carbonation,  Mild bitterness, crisp finish.  Moderately dry.  A top tier pale ale.

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2012 Tap at HF and growler at home.  This is what many breweries should be doing for anniversary beers instead of these crazy messes with 13 hops and malts, and 7 yeasts.  I like Shaun as a brewer because he sticks with something he does well and works very hard to make those beers great. He could have easily jumped in on the "sour and wild beer craze" and i happen to know that he probably would make some great ones, but instead hes still working on creating awesome drinkable pale ale and world class (which cant be said for many American brewers) saisons.

On tap at Jose Pistolas.  Foggy orange yellow with a slim white head.  Nose is orange and mango with hints of pineapple, cherry and pine.  Medium body with a tingle.  Taste is orange, mango, cat and club soda.  Finishes dry with pine and more funky feline.

Growler, courtesy Mike, thank you sir! Pour is pale gold with a nice white head, good retention/lacing. Aroma of citrus, floral hops, cracker malts. Taste is moderately bitter, grapefruit, grassy hops, lightly sweet. Palate is somewhat dry, crisp carbonation, lightly bitter finish. Super clean and refreshing.

This one thanks to yobdoog! Pours pale golden with a small white head quickly fading to a film extremely hazy. Nose is bright citrus, resinous pines, tropical fruits and other various dank hops.  Flavor is resinous pines again, floral grass, sweet pineapple. Dry in the finish. Little to no caramel malt flavor which is a plus. medium bitterness. Another great beer from HF.

750 ml growler sent by lushawn- thanks again, Shawn! Pours a hazy gold with a small cream-colored head that settles into an uneven film. Big, fruity aroma- melon, citrus, mango and other tropical fruits, sweet malts, and some herbal and grassy notes. The flavor doesnt have the same fruity pop, but has more grassy and herbal notes, lemon citrus, melon, and sweet malts. Initially dank but then dry on the palate. Light-bodied, with modest carbonation. Really nice.

Bottle shared by yourefragile: Pours a clear pale golden with a stringy-lacing white head.  Has a fresh citrusy and pale malty nose with a touch of herbal grassy hops.  Starts with pretty good fullness and good light sweetness with lots of clean resinous hop flavor and bitter balance before a drier, crisp finish.  Incredibly fresh and drinkable.

Super fresh grapefruit juice nose with a touch of floral hops and some sugary cotton candy. Light and dry flavor with a touch honey leading to frsh citrus and flowers. Lightly bitter finish.  Lovely,  easy drinking, awesome.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2012 tap at hill farmstead, then growler taken home.   aroma of bright, juicy grapefruit, papaya, citrusy tropical fruits, some pineapple.    moderate-heavy resin and pine bitterness lingers on the palette, but is balanced nicely by the fresh  papaya sweetness.  hop forward fo sho though.  awesome, bright, juicy citrus fruit pale ale.  complex.  dry.  tasty.  like a lot.

Bottle 75 cl, tnx to Kan. Pours hazy golden with a small off white head leaving lacing. Aroma is malty dry a bit fruity hay spicy. Flavor is dry acidy malty in the beginning bitterness and tones of tea added in the mddle turning to more bitter dry finish.

750 ml growler from Hill.  Also tried this at the anniversary party.  Pour is bright golden and hazy.  Aroma of dank hops, some cat piss and pine needles.  Taste is more pine, some grapefruit as well.  This beer distances itself from Edward in the mouthfeel; really crisp and not sticky at all.  Finish is lingering pine.  At the fest, this was probably my favorite beer of the day.  Super refreshing.  I can drink the hell out of this beer.  I want this all the time.  Please continue making this beer Shaun!

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2012  Had this guy for the first time at the Hill Farmstead 2nd Anniversary party and didnt love it then. Wanting to give it a second shot (when I wasnt drinking it after so many other tasty treats at the event) I brought a growler home and....still dont love it. Dont get me wrong, its a really nice beer but I dont think it stands at the top of most of the other Hill Farmstead Beers Ive had recently. 

Pours a nice straw, slightly reddish color with a decent head that dissipates quickly. Smells delicious---pine, maybe a little papaya in there. Tastes pretty good, hop, grapefruit/orange peel...but a little too heavy on the peel. Bitterness lingers a bit for my liking. 

A nice beer, I just want a softer finish I think...

Pouring at the second anniversary party.  Pours a hazed gold with a  medium sized white head.  Big sweet citrus on the nose, warm pine.  Soft musk, sweet malt.  Toast, clean and dry.  Slow bitter finish.  Fantastic stuff.

Growler courtesy of oteyj, thank you sir!  Cloudy variegated yellow orange color, thick fluffy white head, good retention. Aroma of freshly cut wet grass, very subtle pine. Taste is light grass, citrus, hay. Really easy to drink. Good stuff.

2L growler thanks to oteyj. Glowing tangerine, full haze pour. Huge ice cream scoop retention with 360 sheety lace and perfect, amazing rockiness. Crazy looking pour.  Rich rich West Coast mega dry hop with huge mango, tangerine, grapefruit, butterscotch. Like the best bottles of Sculpin, Alesmith IPA, and Alpine Duet. Taste begins with rich butterscotch, small caramel, juicy and tangy, with heavy whipped cream and vanilla ice cream. Sorbet, super silky palate. Feels like a shot of peach whipped cream. Very little alcohol warming. Very light, fluffy, refreshing. Has all the complexities and fruitiness of the best IPAs in the world but no sticky body and no alcohol presence.

Verre, dun fût lors du 2e anniversaire de Hill Farmstead. Arômes intenses de houblon américain (agrumes, pêches, ananas). Robe blonde et très trouble, belle petite mousse et effervescence souple. En bouche, le houblon se montre vraiment très aromatique et fruité, très porté sur les agrumes. Le corps est très velouté malgré la grande sécheresse de la bière. Finale moyennement amère pour le style. Une très belle Pale Ale/IPA, un peu moins résineuse et amère que Edward.

From 750 ml bottle filled at brewery. Hazy straw yellow appearance. Faint grapefruit aroma. Dry, lackluster flavor. Bitter finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 2, 2012 On tap at the Hill Farmstead 2nd Anniversary party. Hazy golden yellow pour with a mountainous white frothy head. Giant citrus and juicy fruit notes give way to nectar fruit, scallion, and evergreen. Massively drinkable with a light body, medium carbonation, and dry crisp finish.  

After drinking an entire 2L growler of this with surprising ease, and another with friends, I think I must up my rating. The sessionability of this combined with the massive flavor and aroma profile makes this an incredible brew.  

Ok one more re-rate. I had this at the brewery side by side with Society 4, Abner, Walden, and Edward and it really stood out as one of my favorites. The hop flavor rivaled that of the big boys, but it had the drinkability of Walden. Maybe its that Im in a session beer mood lately, but this is truly one of the best pale ales Ive ever had.

Smells like rusty farm equipment (in a good way) and is basically that colour. Well, kind of like a hazy straw colour. Damn bitter but pretty good overall product. Great head, good tracing. On tap at the Farmhouse Tap and Grill in Burlington.

Picked this up yesterday at 3PM at Hill Farmstead Brewery. Placed it in the fridge and poured into a Hill Farmstead Glass at 40 Degrees F. At the pop of the growler top, an eruption of pressure shot out some beer. Made me smile a bit.

A -Gorgeous beer! So beautiful. SRM of 9. Bright Yellow with a hint of brown. Very haze full beer. Head of 2-fingers with crystal clear bubbles and a solid head lacing. This beer is so pretty. 

S - Big bright hop scent before even pouring it. Big Simcoe hop aroma. Im getting Citra as well. Bright grassy citrus scent. Im getting wheat as well.

T - Very nice. Deliciously well balanced hops, very light malts and seems perfect to enjoy on this day of gardening and spring cleaning. Dry hopped Amarillo hops? Orange peels? Its a very simple beer yet very complex. Hard to point out any one ingredient. One word. Delicious.

M - 80% carbonation on the mouth swish. Light body. Very crisp grassy finish.

O - Wow. Thanks Shaun. You make the best beers in the world.

A pour from the brewery prior to the release and naming of this tasty beer thanks to Shaun. Slightly cloudy in appearance and golden orange in color. The floral hops make their presence known in the aroma with lemon and citrus. Medium bodied and smooth. Fresh clean flavors of light tropical notes with a natural earthy quality. Nice bitter dry finish and well balanced and tasty. The hop profile is awesome and a nice nod to the Alpine beer which was its inspiration.

Provided by Sean for our Saturday night tasting. Thanks for the tick Sean! Pours a light yellow with a quarter fingers worth spritzy white head. Nose is perfect, the Amarillo and simcoe are bright and fresh. A lot pine and earthiness as well. Nice dry pine, not overpoweringly bitter, quite nice. Moderate bitterness, medium mouthfeel, somewhat spritzy.  Really nice APA, probably one of the best hop forward beers ive had from HF. Sean is killing it right.

32oz growler courtesy of Sean... Pours a mostly hazy lemony orange hue, mostly opaque, and topped with a thin to medium soapy white head that eventually recedes towards the edges... Aroma is token Shaun which is assertive pungent dank tropical fruit and citrus accents. Burst of hops are relentless... Flavors continue on a similar wavelength with juicy fruity tropical fruit and dank overtones. Hops abound and just seem so incredibly fresh with a crisp semi-dry finish. Refreshing at this point but welcoming in any situation. Easy goin and mild body, not too light or heavy.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2012 Big thanks to a great trader for the 750mL growler.  Served in a Hill Farmstead long stem tulip.  Pours a slightly cloudy pale apricot with a really nice white head and quite a bit of lacing.  The nose has some light pineapple along with great citrus character and a bit of rind.  Extraordinarily flavorful.  Hoppy and great bitterness through the finish.  Mouthfeel is unmatched.  Classic Hill Farmstead.  Love it.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

on tap at HFS. Pours a hazy orange golden color with a dense head that holds up for a while. smell is tropical fruits, mango, peach cream with light esters and light malt presence. taste is crisp tropical fruits, mango, peaches with a mild malt. mouthfeel is dry, medium body with a tingly carbonation. wholly satisfying pale ale.
Good pale ale.  The hops are pretty large with moderate bitterness that is a bit high for a pale ale.  Aroma and taste is lemon, resin, and tropical notes with a dry bitter finish.

Growler and on tap at Prohibition Pig.  Cloudy orange pour with a finger of head.  Gorgeous aroma - Floral hops, grapefruit, pine, orange.  Dangerously drinkable - Grapefruit, Orange, lemon zest, bready malt finishes.  Medium body, carb is spot on.  One of the better IPAs Ive had and if Harmstead followed through on their April Fools gag and canned this, id bring back a skid over the border.
On draft at the brewery.  Cloudy orangish color, with a nice white head.  Grapefruit and piney in aroma and taste.  Nice bitterness.
On tap at hill farmstead,sticky bananas. That is all. Steeeeeke.

750 ml. growler from the brewery. Very floral hoppy, complex and fresh and welcoming. Cloudy grapefruit with fluffy head. Tremendous drinkability. Orange citrus, Simcoe? Seems to be a blend of American and British hops.Smooth drinker. An excellent pale, with perhaps the IBU of what used to be called an IPA.Thanks John.

750 ml bottle obtained from the brewery. Pours out a cloudy light yellow-orange brew with a big frothty white head. Lots of aromatics. Flavor is light sweet bready with some spice. Lots of fruit notes, a little pine. Light and extremely smooth overall. Not sticky. Lingering light bitter-bread finish. Very well made and very, very fresh tasting.
